abstract: Mine Safety and Health Admin says nation’s coal mines set a record for the lowest number of on-the-job fatalities in 2014, with 16.
lead_paragraph: The nation’s coal mines set a record for the lowest number of on-the-job fatalities last year, with 16, the U.S. Department of Labor’s Mine Safety and Health Administration said Monday.
snippet: The nation’s coal mines set a record for the lowest number of on-the-job fatalities last year, with 16, the U.S. Department of Labor’s Mine Safety and Health Administration said Monday.

headline.main: Washington: Deaths in Coal Mines at a Record Low
headline.print_headline: 16 Deaths in Coal Mines in 2014 Were a Record Low
